summary: I'm a graduate student at Toronto Metropolitan University in the Spatial Analysis Program, with lots of experience with computer science, software development, GIS, and spatial analysis, looking to for opportunities to expand my skillset and explore interesting ideas and projects.
long-summary: I'm a graduate student at Toronto Metropolitan University in the Master of Spatial Analysis program. With a High Honours Undergraduate degree in Computer Science from the University of Guelph I am a strong programmer with a background in python, C, and Javascript programming, having worked in computer vision and as a small-scale web developer. I'm a passionate about the outdoors and the environment, having worked as an outdoor educator and canoe camping guide. I've worked with the Toronto and Region Conservation Authority (TRCA) and Ducks Unlimited Canada in their conservation efforts in Southern Ontario.  My current research addresses salt vulnerability in urban watersheds and aims to use GIS and spatial analysis technology to identify salt-vulnerable-vulnerable areas in the Greater Toronto Area.

points: Ongoing Thesis

education.program: Honours Bachelor of Computing, Major in Computer Science, Minor in Geographic Information Systems and Environmental Analysis
points: Graduated with Distinction.

projects.title: Site Suitability Index for Small Wetlands in Southern Ontario
projects.description: Worked with Ducks Unlimited Canada to research and build an index model for identifying wetland conservation and conversion sites.
points: Performed literature review of research on key wetland features and conservation.
Used GIS software to normalize data layers and create a suitability index using a Multi-Criteria-Evaluation approach.
Part of GIS Project Management Applications Course at TMU

projects.title: Evaluating Toronto's Bike Share Program
projects.description: A map poster exploring the use of and access to bike share in the city of Toronto.
points: Worked with large datasets representing millions of ridership records
Using GIS software to consolidate and map ridership across the city of Toronto in 2024.
Part of Cartography and Geovisualization Course at TMU

projects.title: Productivity Apps
projects.description: A collection of finished and work-in-progress repositories with simple productivity tools available through my github page.
points: budget-tracker-app for keeping track of day-to-day expenses written with React Native
mass-image-reseizer using openCV to resize images from a folder
pdf-combine-script a simple way of combining pdf files

projects.title: Analysis of Toronto Bike Share Program
projects.description: Exploring public information from the City of Toronto on bike infrastructure and bike share usage.
points: Pulling detailed statistics from public ridership information to analyze bike share usage and growth.
Using python scripting with GIS APIs and Pandas to generate statistics and create geometry.
Map design and information communication.

projects.title: Auto Resume
projects.description: Use a user-defined LaTeX schematic to generate a formatted resume with relevant points from user information.
points: Designed project overview including formatting of input JSON data.
Developed generic python wrapper to run user-written code corresponding to a given LaTeX format.
Was used to make this resume!
Available on github.

projects.title: Ant - Director of Photography, Producer
points: Helped plan and execute shooting locations, storyboards, direction, lighting, sound and videography
Operated camera and audio equipment on set.
Worked closely with director and actors to ensure smooth and efficient shoot days.
Intimately involved in pre and post-production processes.

projects.title: Moose Habitat Suitability Modelling in Northern Ontario
projects.description: Evaluation and analysis of Moose Habitat sustainability in the Missinaibi Forest
points: Collaborated with students and graduate to identify areas of concern, research plan.
Performed a detailed literature review of moose habitat suitability and environmental concerns related to indstrial logging, including government policy and forestry guidelines.
Investaged and prepared vector data provided through government resources and forestry for analysis.
Derived raster layers and relevant information and developed a Habitat suitability model using ArcGIS pro.
Available through my website.

projects.title: Program Planner Website
projects.description: Full-stack serviced webpage delivering detailed information about prerequisites, course searching, program informaition using web-scraped university data, built on React.
points: Used AGILE methodology in a team setting to ensure effective software development as a team leader across multiple sprints
Built user-friendly front end application using React, React Flow and other libraries, Bootstrap, and Javascript.
Organized weekly requirements, scheduled team meetings, lead code review sessions
Used Flask, NGINX, Python for backend development on a Linux server.

projects.title: Sole of a Salesman - Composer
projects.description: Composed, recordered, and produced soundtrack for independent student short horror film.
points: Wrote, recorded, and produced music using digital tools and real instruments.
Worked closely with director to match tone of film and assess needs.

projects.title: The Grove Youth Wellness Hubs App Design
projects.description: Took part in designing a social media app for a local community partner.
points: Communicated with client to assemble requirements and key features for a social media app.
Involed Waterfall design methodology to build a development plan, collaborated with team members on requirements and UI design.

work-experience.title: GIS Intern

Used ESRI products to design dashboards, create custom raster functions, support GIS data product creation.
Used Feature Manipulation Engine and python to automate data workflows and generate detailed analytics reports.

work-experience.title: Undergraduate Research Assistant

Used PyTorch and OpenCV to train a residual neural network to classify cattle in frames of video to support concurrent agriculture research.
Code available on github.

Planned and organized 3-to-7-day white-water and flat-water wilderness canoe camping trips for groups of 8 to 10 campers.
Worked with staff to ensure safe environments for learning and adventure. Promoted clean and sustainable camping practices.
Monitored group dynamics and encouraged growth of teamwork and communication skills among campers.
Maintained a clean environment in-camp including boat repair and site maintenance.

work-experience.title: Cook
points: Worked in a fast-paced high-pressure environment to ensure timely delivery of quality prepared food.

volunteer-experience.title: Quartermaster
